metadata.title: CVE-2015-7545 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The (1) git-remote-ext and (2) unspecified other remote helper programs inGit before 2.3.10, 2.4.x before 2.4.10, 2.5.x before 2.5.4, and 2.6.xbefore 2.6.1 do not properly restrict the allowed protocols, which mightallow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a URL in a (a).gitmodules file or (b) unknown other sources in a submodule.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7545` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

git - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
git-all - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
git-arch - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
git-bzr - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
git-core - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
git-cvs - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
git-daemon-run - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
git-daemon-sysvinit - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
git-el - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
git-email - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
git-gui - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
git-man - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
git-mediawiki - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
git-svn - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
gitk - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
gitweb - 1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: git package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.9.1-1ubuntu0.2').
